topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d59433636872414abd0100#post_54d59433636872414abd0100
[bq="Too_Offensive"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d5940163687245c06c4600#post_54d5940163687245c06c4600
I'd hope it would be sooner than that but you're probably right. [/bq]
My guess is that Valve is massively over-estimating how successful steambox is going to be because it's a launch console and is going to go "OH SHIT!" when they watch the release sales.  I'll admit I'm a valve fan, *BUT* the thing is that they're drastically over-estimating their steambox sales; sure in the long run chances are steambox is going to be a game changer, *BUT* it's a work in progress operating system and it's a launch console/pc and very rarely does a console sell hundreds of millions of products for a first time of someone getting into the market.


Basically I have $50 on:
Late 2015 SteamOS is released
SteamOS on launch only has a couple million users
Valve goes "OH SHIT!  QUICK!  RELEASE HALF-LIFE 3!"
Everyone goes fucking nuts buys Half-Life 3 and by proxy get SteamOS
10 years from now SteamOS is the default operating system

Call me crazy or a conspiracy theorist, but I totally can see them having Half-Life 3 already completed and only to be released in case of a rainy day.
